agency_desc: A nonprofit social services agency interacting with families through an innovative case management approach.
site_name: BRIDGES FOR LIFE - FIRST PRESBYTERIAN CHURCH
service_description: Provides resources and support for individuals with alcohol and other drug addictions, including referrals for treatment options, family support, transportation as needed, and needed personal items when entering treatment.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to request services. -- Leave a voicemail with your name and phone number if no answer.
site_eligibility: Living in Wayne County
Open

agency_name: INDIANA HOUSING AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY - BALANCE OF STATE CONTINUUM OF CARE
agency_desc: This is not a true agency record, but rather a collection of lead regional agencies providing coordinated entry services to individuals and families experiencing homelessness.
service_description: Leads housing intake, assessment, referrals, and placement coordination for individuals and families experiencing homelessness.
nameLevel3: At Risk/Homeless Housing Related Assistance Programs
site_details: Call for information or to schedule an assessment appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Fayette, Franklin, Rush, Union, or Wayne County -- Currently and chronically homeless (living on the street, unable to obtain shelter, or living in uninhabitable conditions)

agency_name: INDIANA FAMILY AND SOCIAL SERVICES ADMINISTRATION - LONG-TERM CARE OMBUDSMAN PROGRAM
agency_desc: A division of the Indiana Family and Social Services Administration that advocates for residents of Indiana long-term care facilities, which includes nursing facilities and licensed assisted living facilities, to promote and protect resident rights guaranteed under federal and state law.
service_description: Receives, investigates, and attempts to resolve problems or complaints involving residents of long-term care facilities (nursing facilities, residential care facilities, assisted-living facilities, adult foster care homes, and county residential care facilities) located in Fayette, Franklin, Rush, Union, and Wayne County.
site_details: Call for information, advocacy, referrals, or to make a complaint.
site_eligibility: Persons with questions or complaints about long-term care facilities located in Fayette, Franklin, Rush, Union, or Wayne County

agency_desc: A community nonprofit offering a variety of services for domestic violence victims as well as seniors and youth.
service_description: Provides support services to men and women who are victims of domestic violence or sexual assault. Services may include court accompaniment, protective order filing, and case management.
site_details: Call the crisis line or the office for information or to request support services.
site_eligibility: Victims of domestic violence
Female or male victims of domestic violence (with or without children 21 or younger)

agency_desc: A community action agency that designs, sponsors, and administers programs that provide help for today and hope for tomorrow.
site_name: INTERLOCAL COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM - WAYNE COUNTY
service_description: Serves as an application and re-certification site for the Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher program in Wayne County. Housing Choice Vouchers help eligible households pay the rent on privately owned homes of their choosing (property owners must agree to program participation). The wait list for Housing Choice Vouchers in this area is currently CLOSED. People already on the wait list must keep their contact information current to remain on the list.
site_details: Application process is currently CLOSED. Local media will announce when the wait list opens. -- People already on the wait list, call to update contact information as needed.
site_eligibility: When the wait list is open, income guidelines will be posted. Preference is given to seniors, persons with disabilities, and working families.

agency_desc: The Refuge of Hope is a Christ centered facility for women who are in times of need.
service_description: Provides a temporary shelter for women that have no safe place to stay.
site_details: Call to schedule an intake assessment
site_eligibility: Women with or without children

agency_name: BUREAU OF REHABILITATION SERVICES - INDIANA DIVISION OF DISABILITY AND REHABILITATIVE SERVICES
agency_desc: A state agency Bureau that serves persons with disabilities so that they may achieve and maintain employment.
service_description: Provides a range of employment services for persons with physical or mental impairment. Applicants receive assessment to determine eligibility and vocational rehabilitation needs. Eligible persons may receive counseling and guidance, referrals to vocational training and placement programs, and funding for rehabilitation services as appropriate to achieve an employment goal.
site_details: Call for information, to apply for services, and/or to discuss your employment needs.
site_eligibility: Have a physical or mental impairment that, based on assessment, constitutes or results in a substantial impediment to employment -- Requiring vocational rehabilitation services to prepare for, enter, engage in, or retain appropriate employment

agency_desc: Provides electricity to customers living in the city of Richmond.
service_description: Provides electric service to persons living in the city of Richmond in Wayne County. Provides account information, connection/disconnection services, and payment options. Customer service representatives may be able to negotiate customized payment plans to assist customers in crisis situations, either directly or through a social service agency advocating on the client's behalf. RPL offers a variety of billing options and special programs, including:   * Budget Billing: Pay the same amount every month (based on prior use) and settle the      difference at least once a year. Customers must be current on their bill, and have a billing     history of at least 12 months to enroll in this plan.   * Extensions: Postpone payment when unforeseen situations prevent paying the bill on      time. Call customer service to check eligibility.
